New Records: The Guardians are the first in AL postseason history to score five runs without an out being recorded, according to Elias Sports Bureau and Stats Perform.
Key Match Events: Steven Kwan opened the game with a double off the right field wall.
Lane Thomas hit a three-run homer on the first pitch of his postseason career.
Cade Smith struck out four straight batters.
Emmanuel Clase retired the Tigers in order to complete the four-hit shutout.
Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians earned a bye to reach the ALDS by finishing with the second best record in the league on the way to winning the AL Central.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised the team's readiness and early performance.
Tiger manager A.J. Hinch acknowledged the difficulty of overcoming Cleveland's early lead.
Bibee expressed relief and satisfaction after his first postseason game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on a sunny Saturday afternoon.
The Guardians had six days off before the game, one of which was due to a rainout on the last day of the regular season.
